chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

∸ Zp = Zp

Zp_is_ring = {| Radd_0_l := Zp_plus_zero; Radd_comm := Zp_plus_comm; Radd_assoc := Zp_plus_assoc; Rmul_1_l := Zp_mult_one; Rmul_comm := Zp_mult_comm; Rmul_assoc := Zp_mult_assoc; Rdistr_l := fun x y z : Z_Zp => Zp_mult_plus_distr_r z x y; Rsub_def := fun x y => eq_refl; Ropp_def := Zp_minus |} : ring_theory Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
div_eq_0 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, n < p -> div n p = 0
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments rem (_ _)%nat_scope

bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope

utils_nat.first_non_zero : forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat), f 0 = 0 -> f n <> 0 -> exists i : nat, i < n /\ (forall k : nat, k <= i -> f k = 0) /\ f (i + 1) <> 0
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
Nat.pred_inj : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> Nat.pred n = Nat.pred m -> n = m
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat2Pos.inj_compare : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> (n ?= m) = (Pos.of_nat n ?= Pos.of_nat m)%positive
Nat2Pos.inj_mul : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> Pos.of_nat (n * m) = (Pos.of_nat n * Pos.of_nat m)%positive
Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p = Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
Nat.pow_eq_0 : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a ^ b = 0 -> a = 0
Nat.div_mul_cancel_l : forall a b c : nat, b <> 0 -> c <> 0 -> c * a / (c * b) = a / b
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.eq_dec : forall n m : nat, {n = m} + {n <> m}
rem_erase : forall q n p r : nat, q = n * p + r -> rem q p = rem r p
Init.Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Init.Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.odd _%nat_scope
Nat.mul_mod_distr_r : forall a b c : nat, b <> 0 -> c <> 0 -> (a * c) mod (b * c) = a mod b * c
Nat.div_0_l : forall a : nat, a <> 0 -> 0 / a = 0
Nat.div_same : forall a : nat, a <> 0 -> a / a = 1
